gw.api.policy.refresh

Interface PolicyRefreshConfiguration


  • public interface PolicyRefreshConfiguration
    Encapsulates the parts of policy refresh that are customer configurable. For many customers the configuration allowed by this interface will provide all the flexibility they need. They should apply their customizations to the corresponding concrete configuration classes and then create a very simple subclass of the out of box base policy refresh plugin, handing in their configuration class as its only argument.

    Customers who do not find this sufficient also have the option of overriding or entirely replacing any of the methods provided by the base policy refresh plugin.

    • Method Detail

      • getPolicyExtractor

        PolicyExtractor getPolicyExtractor(Policy policy)
        Returns an extractor that can be used to construct the graph of entities that are part of the policy graph for the given policy
        Parameters:
        policy - the policy a the root of the graph
        Returns:
        an extractor that can build a graph containing all entities belonging to the policy

      • getRelinkFilters

        java.util.List<RelinkFilter> getRelinkFilters()
        (Optional) Returns a list of gw.api.policy.refresh.relink.RelinkFilters that will be invoked before and after the relinking is performed, but before any entities are retired. Listeners will be invoked in the order in which they are defined in the list. Implementations that do not have any listeners should return an empty list.
        Returns:
        The list of relink listeners

      • getMatcherTypes

        java.util.Map<IEntityType,java.lang.Class<? extends EntityMatcher>> getMatcherTypes()
        Returns a map of matcher types by entity type. Whenever the policy refresh algorithm needs a matcher for an entity type it will look up the matcher type in this map and then instantiate the matcher. The keys in the map should all be entity types (e.g. Address, Policy etc.) The values should be Gosu classes which implement the EntityMatcher interface.
        Returns:
        map of matcher types by entity type

      • getDiffDisplayTypes

        java.util.Map<IEntityType,java.lang.Class<? extends DiffDisplay>> getDiffDisplayTypes()
        Returns a map of diff display types by entity type. Whenever the policy refresh algorithm needs a diff display object for an entity type it will look up the diff display type in this map and then instantiate the matcher. The keys in the map should all be entity types (e.g. Address, Policy etc.) The values should be Gosu classes which implement the DiffDisplay interface.
        Returns:
        map of diff display types by entity type

      • getCustomRelinkerTypes

        java.util.Map<IEntityType,java.lang.Class<? extends RelinkHandler>> getCustomRelinkerTypes()
        Returns a map of relink handlers by entity type. When the policy refresh algorithm replaces the existing policy with a new policy, it will relink any arrays or foreign keys on the existing Claim that referenced entities in the Policy that will be replaced (and vice versa). By default, the behavior is to relink any array or foreign key where the entity being replaced has a match in the PolicyComparison. This behavior can be overriden by providing custom relink handlers that implement RelinkHandler, e.g. if the desired behavior is to preserve certain entities that would otherwise be retired.
        Returns:
        A map of entity types to relink handlers
        See Also:
        DefaultRelinkHandler

      • getDisplayTree

        Tree<IEntityType> getDisplayTree()
        Configuration for converting the policy graph into a tree structure to display in the UI
        Returns:
        a Tree of types with edges weighted with PropertyWeights

      • getEntityPropertiesToIgnoreForComparison

        java.util.Set<IPropertyInfo> getEntityPropertiesToIgnoreForComparison()
        Set of properties in the policy graph to ignore when determining if the policies under comparison actually have differences.
        Returns:
        The set of properties to ignore
